Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaFrequenttraveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly driver picked us up at the airport and smiling staff greeted us upon arrival. Hotel is attractive and room was perfect. Comfortable stay with a great breakfast. Thank you for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical clean Marriott hotel but becareful of the Interstate noise”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: This clean two room suite is fine for travelers on a budget. It was clean, had free internet, free breakfast, and nightly cocktails. The front desk staff was great. Be sure to request an interior room away from the interstate. I was there two nights and several times each night I awoken to traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: songofthedodo
Reviews.Content: One of the best places to stay just outside of the downtown area. Some of the best resturants and clubs are just down the road. Will always stay here when I come to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “I will never be back”
Reviews.Author: 54cindyk
Reviews.Content: The night front desk worker Andrew is more than beyond rude!!! I will never stop at this Marriott again horrible location and a very old style room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “actually a sweet suite”
Reviews.Author: obuoy4848
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to take care of us and our delayed luggage. The rooms are really suites--with door between living and bedroom, sink is not in shower room, making it easy for a family to get ready for the day. Also, the snacks & breakfast food were great and the staff went above and beyond to keep us happy!

Reviews.Title: “Showing some age”
Reviews.Author: econsultant
Reviews.Content: This hotel probably used to be pretty nice, but very clearly showing its age now. The suite room was average, with older style non-flat screen TVs. The AC unit was very noisy, but that did keep down the noise from the freeway. I would not want to venture out nearby on foot. Topping it off, there was a tree roach on the wall of the living area in the morning. However, the staff was great. The shuttle service to Love Field was efficient, and since I was leaving before the breakfast opened the next morning, they provide some simple breakfast items the night before.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 stars at best”
Reviews.Author: BizDevRoadee
Reviews.Content: This is like an older hotel trying to look/feel new and higher-end. First impression was the main doors into the hotel had to be opened by the employee at the counter, which tells you about the neighborhood I guess. My room as just ok. The TV is old-school small CRT, no flat screen LCD or plasma. The door to the bathroom had obviously been kicked-in at some point, as the door frame was nailed back together and "hidden" with white caulking. The furniture and fixtures were nice, but the details tell you this was just a quick "renovation". Thankfully I was only there for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre rooms in need of updating...”
Reviews.Author: EricRode
Reviews.Content: Mediocre rooms in need of updating. Terrible neighborhood. Housekeeping overall is poor. There are much better choices in DFW. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: lws2001
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at a Springhill Suites, I was nervous about what I would walk in to. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of service and room. The Staff greeted us kindly and got us checked in promptly. I had a few problems with my room key, but they were very nice and quick to apologize and resolve. The room was very clean. The breakfast in the morning was very good and there were plenty of options to choose from. In addition, the free hotel shuttle is great, they will take you just about anywhere (within a certain mileage) you need to go... restaurants, store etc. I've got no complaints about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I practically lived here for 4 months. GREAT staff, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TexasMason1429
Reviews.Content: I stayed here nearly every M-F from October through the end of January. It was a great location for my client, so it was a very good fit. Pro: The staff here is OUTSTANDING. From Donna Bolts (Sales Manager) to Anna who worked the breakfast area in the morning, the service was very, very good. The property was clean, the gym was good, and the buffet in the morning and snacks and soda in the evening were great. Con: This is not a particularly nice area, but there are some convenient places nearby: food (lots of good mid-range/chain restaurants), movie theater, etc. If you go past the movie theater (on the left) you quickly start running into strip clubs, massage parlors and the like. Not good. I would recommend this hotel for anyone doing business in the medical center area (harry hines). There is another Marriott Property (Courtyard) nearby, but the parking lot is divided by a large liquor store.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: loraccity
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, appetizers, and cookies. Rooms were spacious. The only criticism is the gym is a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorBluffton
Reviews.Content: While located adjacent to I-35W the room was quiet. Plenty of living space, but the desk area could use better lighting. Excellent continental breakfast with both hot and cold items. In an area with easy access to major highways and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Extras”
Reviews.Author: yunicorner
Reviews.Content: This is the first Springhill Suites I've seen that has a cocktail hour. There are food and drinks every week day from 5-7pm. Most days the food is simple with one hot appetizer, chips, crackers, and snack mix. On Tuesdays, they have a dinner entree and salad. Drinks include beer, wine, and soda. Plus, they have the usual Otis Spunkmeyer cookies at the front desk. The staff were all friendly and helpful. I stayed there for 2 1/2 weeks and the front desk staff remembered me after the first week. I took the shuttle every day and all the shuttle drivers were friendly too. Shuttle pick-up was very prompt and I never had to wait long. I think you can take the hotel shuttle anywhere within a 2-mile radius of the hotel. The only problem is that the shuttle does not run on the weekends. Your other transportation options from DAL airport include the SuperShuttle or taxi which is around $20 with tip. The suites I stayed in had the bathroom separating the bedroom and living area making it feel like a 1-bedroom suite. I stayed in 3 different suites like that so I assume most of the suites are situated in that fashion. The rooms were neat and clean. I never had an issue with water pressure or hot water. The only thing I didn't like about the room was that there was no digital temperature setting. You have to manually adjust the air settings in your bedroom. The gym was a little bigger and had more equipment than other Springhill ones. There were 2 elevators for the 3-story hotel. One located next to the hotel entrance and one located in the middle of the hotel which I thought was pretty helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, terrible part of town”
Reviews.Author: kmkt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this SHSuites a couple of months ago and I was very disappointed. The room was nice, clean and larger than most SH Suites however the part of town is very questionable. My children and I were approached by unsavory characters in the parking lot and in the hotel hallway. Also, the hotel was having a meeting on Saturday morning and hundreds of people were in the breakfast area waiting to attend the meeting in the hotel. They were just hanging out as the hotel guests tried to eat their breakfast, management should have had them wait in the meeting room not hanging out in the breakfast eating area. I would not stay here again as we did not feel at all comfortable. Most SH Suites are great, I was surprised by this one and its management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Originalsweetone
Reviews.Content: Attended a training class at this hotel. I enjoyed the room, the food and the staff. I'm not too crazy about the location. The pool and other amenities were nice. The evening cookies were delicious. I will be back for another class and look forward to another comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: blaqwynter
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasent stay, I was with my b/f at the time and the beds were comfortable. The staff were friendly, and other services were quick and excellent. I will return here one day.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas has a secret!”
Reviews.Author: bhavi09
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a stay at the Springhill suites. Well, I must say, Dallas has been hiding this gem for too long!! It was not a multi billion dollar resort, but provided service and food that you would expect from a property charging hundreds more per night. Overall, the experience we had was amazing, from the smiles that greeted us at checkin to the full breakfast, I had an amazing trip. If you find this property anything but astounding I will be shocked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hard to find”
Reviews.Author: wecamp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to Houston. This was a very nice clean hotel. It was a little hard to find if you come in from the west. We had to ask directions at a local store. It's hidden behind a nother hotel and you can't see the sign. But once we found it the hotel was great. Clean and we really like to 2 room set up of the suites. 2 tvs were great. There was plently of places toeat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bozbird
Reviews.Content: My mom was having surgery at the NEARBY UT Southwestern Hospital complex. W/c accessable rooms, King bed in b/r, pullout queen in living room. Fairly quiet until the maids start their tirade in the morning. Nice am buffet. Homeade cookies in the evening. Great staff. Close parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for football fans!”
Reviews.Author: Jenwee
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a preseason game that my husband and I went to while in Dallas. I was a little nervous staying here since the other reviews are kind of old. But what a deal! We got our room for $85 for the night. We had a king sized bed that was a 'suite' with a pullout couch and microwave and fridge. Our room was clean and the bathroom was a good size. The hotel is very close to Cowboys stadium (it was a little tricky getting into the hotel so luckily we had some good maps). The hotel is just one exit away from the red parking lot. The breakfast was ok....I did have some old milk that didnâ€™t taste quite right but once i mentioned it, it was immediately replaced. The pool is outdoor and very nice. The workout facility looked pretty new. The hot tub looked a little dated but was still good. This was an excellent value for its location and I will stay here again :) :)

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites NW Hwy at Stemmons/I-35E
HotelInfo.Address: 2363 Stemmons Trail, Dallas, TX 75220
